page.title: 06Greenhaugh
page.content: Greenhaugh is a hamlet of 14 dwellings clustered around the Holly Bush Inn and with the school on the outskirts. Most of the hamlet formed part of the Greenhaugh estate and when this was recently sold, some of the tenants took the opportunity to buy their homes. Most of the houses are traditional stone and slate. One new bungalow is stone-faced. 5 are detached dwellings, 2 semi-detached, 3 form a terrace and 4 a row opposite. There is a telephone kiosk and a post box. The houses are occupied by; working families with children - 3, working families without children - 4, retired people - 6, vacant at present - 1. Social life centres at the Holly Bush and the school. Twenty years ago there was a shop, post office and forestry office. These have all closed but now there is the school & a garage
